Andy Coulson , 43, has denied knowledge of illegal activities, but he left the paper saying he took responsibility for what happened on his watch. I stand by what I've said about those events, but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on, said Andy Coulson , who had worked for David Cameron for 3 1/2 years. Andy Coulson was "a brilliant member of my team and has thrown himself at the job with skill and dedication," David Cameron said.

Andy Coulson denies being aware of any wrongdoing at the paper, part of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp media group, and police said last month there was not enough evidence to charge him with any crime. Obviously when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at that newspaper and when he found about those, he resigned. That was the right thing to do, David Cameron told BBC Radio 4's Today program. "I gave him a second chance," David Cameron added. "I think he has done a good job for the government and for the country.

That should be enough reason to ensure that it never receives another taxpayer dollar from our government.( Abortions are about 3 percent of Planned Parenthood's overall work.)
